AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception,Clinical Research Excluding Trials,Survivorship

Description: We will explore what high-content omic technologies can offer the oncologist faced with difficult treatment decisions. With an emphasis on quantitative methods, the session will cover: the role of cancer cell plasticity in driving treatment resistance and metastasis; how tumour evolution and ecology impacts outcomes; multicellular single-cell spatial dynamics and immunotherapy response; and circulating biomarkers for real-time monitoring of disease progression. In all, the session will showcase the potential of diverse omic technologies to reveal novel cancer biology and therapeutic opportunities.
PrimaryCategory: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science
SearchResultBody: ADT06. Multiomics in Diagnosis and Care Management
Title: Multiomics in Diagnosis and Care Management
